Turk_Translation_2: in our childhood when we used to see our uncles doing labor work, we used to pray to Allah: that please save us from this hard labor work.
Turk_Translation_3: During your childhood when we our uncles doing their work we prayed Allah to protect us from physical labor.
Turk_Translation_4: And when we in our childhood we used to see our uncles doing strenuous labor it gave birth to this desire in our heart that God protects us from strenuous physical labor.

Urdu: اس سے بچنے کیلئے ہم نے روزنامہ امروز کے ایڈیٹر کو خط لکھا اور پوچھا کہ ہم میٹرک کے بعد کیا کریں کہ ہمیں جسمانی مشقت نہ کرنی پڑے۔
LDC_Translation_1: To get out of this, I wrote a letter to the editor of the Amroze daily newspaper and asked what I should do after graduation so that I don't have to do hard labor.
LDC_Translation_2: To be saved from this, I wrote a letter to the editor of Daily Imroz asking him what to do after Matric so as to avoid physical labor.
LDC_Translation_3: To avoid this, I wrote a letter to the editor of Daily Imroz and asked him what I should do after matriculation so that I did not have to do hard labor.
LDC_Translation_4: To save us from that, we wrote a letter to the editor of Daily Imroz and asked as to what one should do after Metric to be saved from physical labor.
Turk_Translation_1: To save ourselves from this, we wrote a letter to the editor of the Amroz daily, asking him what we can do after metric to save ourselves from having to toil.
Turk_Translation_2: to avoid this we wrote a letter to the editor of the daily Amroz and asked him what should we do after matriculation so that we don't have to do labor work.
Turk_Translation_3: To avoid this we wrote to the editor of monthly Amroz to ask him what to do after matriculation so that we would not have to do physical labor.
Turk_Translation_4: To seek refuge from it we wrote a letter to the editor of daily Amroz and asked “what should we do after matriculation exams that we don’t have to go through strenuous physical labor.

Urdu: ایڈیٹر نے جواب میں لکھا کہ ڈاکٹر یا انجنئر بن جاؤ اور فلاں فلاں مضامین پکڑ لو۔
LDC_Translation_1: The editor wrote back that I should become a doctor or an engineer or take such-and-such subjects.
LDC_Translation_2: The editor in his reply advised to become a doctor or engineer and suggested the reading of specific subjects.
LDC_Translation_3: The editor replied that I should become doctor or engineer and start studying the respective subjects.
LDC_Translation_4: The editor replied that we should become a doctor or an engineer, and suggested a few subjects.
Turk_Translation_1: The editor wrote in reply to become a doctor or engineer and take such and such subjects.
Turk_Translation_2: the editor wrote in reply that we should select certain subjects and become doctors or engineers.
Turk_Translation_3: Editor in reply wrote that we should become Doctor or Engineer and study these courses.
Turk_Translation_4: Editor in his reply wrote that we should become a doctor or an engineer and should opt for such and such subjects to study.

Urdu: ہمارا رجحان شروع سے ہی انجنئرنگ کی طرف تھا اور ہم نے میٹرک میں بھی بیالوجی کی بجائے ٹیکنیکل ڈرائنگ ہی پڑھی۔
LDC_Translation_1: My inclination had always been towards engineering, and I had even taken technical drawing in school instead of biology.
LDC_Translation_2: From the beginning I was interested in engineering, that is why I studied technical drawing instead of biology.
LDC_Translation_3: From the beginning, I was inclined towards engineering and in the matriculation I had studied Technical Drawing instead of Biology.
LDC_Translation_4: As it is, we were interested in engineering, and we passed our Metric exams in technical drawing, not biology.
Turk_Translation_1: My focus was always on engineering, and after metric, instead of Biology, I took Technical Drawing.
Turk_Translation_2: right from beginning my trend was towards engineering and I had selected technical drawing instead of Biology in metric as well.
Turk_Translation_3: We were inclined towards engineering and in matriculation we studied Technical drawing instead of Biology.
Turk_Translation_4: From the beginning we were inclined toward engineering and also in metric we opted for technical drawing instead of biology.

Urdu: لیکن ایف ایس سی میں داخلے کے وقت بڑے بھائی نے مجبور کیا کہ ہم میڈیکل میں ایف ایس سی کر کے ڈاکٹر بنیں۔
LDC_Translation_1: But at the time of the F. Sc. admissions, my older brother forced me to do my F. Sc. in medicine and become a doctor.
LDC_Translation_2: But at the time of admission in F.Sc., my elder brother forced me to become a doctor by doing F.Sc. in pre-medical.
LDC_Translation_3: But at the time of admission in F.Sc., my elder brother forced me to do F.Sc. in pre-medical and become a doctor.
LDC_Translation_4: But when we went to take admission in FSC, my elder brother forced us to take admission in medical FSC and become a doctor.
Turk_Translation_1: But while entering the FSC, my elder brother forced me to do FSC in medicine and become a doctor.
Turk_Translation_2: but at the time of admission in F.Sc. my elder brother forced me to become a doctor after doing F.Sc. in medical.
Turk_Translation_3: But at the time of admissions in FSc the elder brother forced us to study medical in FSc.
Turk_Translation_4: But at the time of admission in FSC elder brother insisted on doing FSC in Pre Medical and become a doctor.

Urdu: ہم نے بمشکل ایک ماہ ہی بیالوجی پڑھی اور جب کچھ بھی پلے نہ پڑا تو اس کے بدلے حساب کا مضمون لے لیا۔
LDC_Translation_1: I studied biology with difficulty for a month, but when I couldn't make heads or tails of it, I changed the subject and took math instead.
LDC_Translation_2: I barely studied biology for a month, but, being unable to understand it, opted to take up mathematics.
LDC_Translation_3: I studied Biology hardly for one month and when I could not understand a word of it, I exchanged it for Mathematics.
LDC_Translation_4: We hardly studied biology for a month, and when we couldn't understand, we exchanged it for mathematics.
Turk_Translation_1: I studied Biology for a month with great difficulty, and when I still could not understand anything, I took maths as a subject instead.
Turk_Translation_2: I studied Biology for hardly a month and then when nothing worked out, I took maths as an alternate subject.
Turk_Translation_3: We hardly studied biology for a month before we started studying maths.
Turk_Translation_4: We hardly studied biology for a month and when we couldn’t understand a thing we swapped biology for Mathematics.

Urdu: یعنی جسمانی مشقت سے ڈر نے ہمیں انجنئر بنا دیا اور اب ہم اپنے خاندان کے بہت سے ہمجولوں میں اچھی پوزیشن پر ہیں جس پر ہم خدا کا ہر وقت شکر ادا کرتے رہتے ہیں۔
LDC_Translation_1: It means the dread of physical labor made me an engineer and now I have a better job than most of my peers in the family, for which I constantly thank God.
LDC_Translation_2: This means that the fear of physical labor helped me to become an engineer, and now among the family members of the same age group, I am in a comparatively better position for which I am always thankful to God.
LDC_Translation_3: I mean the fear of menial labor made an engineer of me and now I am at a very good position among many of my peers and am always thankful to God for this blessing.
LDC_Translation_4: That means, fear from physical labor had made us engineers, and now we are in a much better position in our family and we thank Allah for that.
Turk_Translation_1: So the scare of having to work made me an engineer, and today I am in a very good condition compared to many of my same aged relatives, for which I am always thanking Allah.
Turk_Translation_2: means that the fear from labor work made me an engineer and now I am in a better position than my fellows in the family for which I am always thankful to God.
Turk_Translation_3: Means that to avoid physical labour we became engineer and we are in better position than many friends in our family and we thank Allah for it.
Turk_Translation_4: It means that the fear of strenuous physical jobs made us to become engineers and now we are well placed among many the youth of our family and for this we are thankful to God

Urdu: یہ بات ہمیں اس وقت یاد آئی جب ہم اپنے دو جوان بیٹوں کیساتھ پرانے گھر کے قالین اٹھانے کی کوشش کر رہے تھے۔
LDC_Translation_1: I was reminded of this when I was trying to lift a carpet with our two young sons at our old home.
LDC_Translation_2: This story came to my mind at a time when I, along with my two young sons, was trying to take away the carpets of our old house.
LDC_Translation_3: I was reminded of this when I was trying to lift the carpets from my old home with the help of my two young sons.
LDC_Translation_4: We realized this while we were laying a carpet in our old house with our two young sons.
Turk_Translation_1: I remembered this when I was trying to lift the carpet of my old house along with my two young sons.
Turk_Translation_2: I remembered that when I along with my two sons were trying to remove the carpets from our old house.
Turk_Translation_3: We remembered this when with out 2 young sons we were trying to lift carpets of old hour.
Turk_Translation_4: This we remembered when we were trying to lift carpet from our old house with our two young sons.

Urdu: ابھی کام کرتے آدھا گھنٹہ بھی نہیں ہوا تھا کہ چھوٹا بیٹا بولا “ڈیڈ لگتا ہےمیں اس کام کیلیے پیدا نہیں ہوا”۔
LDC_Translation_1: Not even half an hour had passed when my younger son said, "Dad, looks like I wasn't made to do this kind of work."
LDC_Translation_2: Hardly half an hour had passed after we started doing this job when my younger son said, "Dad! It seems as if I have not been created for this job."
LDC_Translation_3: We were not even half an hour into the work when the younger son said, "Dad, I think I was not born to do this work".
LDC_Translation_4: We were into the work for about half an hour when my younger son said, "Dad, we are not born to do this it seems."
Turk_Translation_1: It was not half an hour since we started working, that the younger son said "Dad, it looks as if I was not made for this job"
Turk_Translation_2: It was only half an hour since he started working that the little boy said " Daddy, I am not born to do this"
Turk_Translation_3: Now it hasn't been half an hour while we were working that the small son said "Daddy it seems that I am not born for this job"
Turk_Translation_4: It was not even 30 minutes for us working that our younger son said “Dad it feels like I am not born for this job.

Urdu: ہم نے کہا اگر یہ سچ ہے تو پھر ہماری طرح خوب پڑھو اور جسمانی مشقت سے جان چھڑا لو۔
LDC_Translation_1: I said, "If this is true, then study hard like me and save yourself from having to do hard labor."
LDC_Translation_2: I said if it is true, then work as hard with your study as I did, and then you will get rid of physical labor.
LDC_Translation_3: I said if this were true then he should study diligently like me and get rid of the menial labor.
LDC_Translation_4: We said, "If it is true, then study hard like us and keep away from physical labor."
Turk_Translation_1: We said, if that is true, then study a lot like us, and free yourself from bodily pain.
Turk_Translation_2: I said that if this is true then study a lot like us and get rid of the physical labor.
Turk_Translation_3: We said that if so study good like us and build up your body.
Turk_Translation_4: We said if it is true then study hard like us and free yourself from physical labor.

Urdu: بیٹا کہنے لگا پڑھ تو میں رہا ہوں اور پڑھ بھی جاؤں گا مگر یہ کام میرے سے نہیں ہوتا۔
LDC_Translation_1: My son said, "I am studying and I'll keep doing it, but I can't do this work."
LDC_Translation_2: My son replied that I am studying and will complete it too, but I cannot do this work.
LDC_Translation_3: The son said that he was studying and would complete his studies but he could not do that kind of work.
LDC_Translation_4: The son said, "I am studying and will study but I cannot do this work."
Turk_Translation_1: The son said that I am studying and will continue studying, but I cannot do this work.
Turk_Translation_2: The son said, "I am studying and I will get through it also but it is the work that I can not do"
Turk_Translation_3: The son started saying I am studying already, will be studying more but this work is not done by me.
Turk_Translation_4: Son started saying that I am studying and will complete my studies but I can’t do this work .

Urdu: جیسے تیسے ہم تینوں نے تین گھنٹے میں وہ کام ختم کیا اور گھر لوٹ آئے۔
LDC_Translation_1: We got the job done as best we could in three hours and returned home.
LDC_Translation_2: All three of us finished this job by hook or by crook in three hours and returned home.
LDC_Translation_3: Somehow, the three of us completed that work in three hours and returned home.
LDC_Translation_4: We finished that work somehow in three hours.
Turk_Translation_1: Anyway, the three of us finished that work in three hours and returned.
Turk_Translation_2: Whatsoever we did that work in three hours and came back home.
Turk_Translation_3: Any how we three managed to complete the work within three hours and returned home.
Turk_Translation_4: Three of us somehow managed to finish the job and got back home.

Urdu: کہنے کا مطلب یہ ہے کہ آدمی اگر منزل کا تعین کر لے چاہے اس کے پیچھے جو بھی وجہ کارفرما ہو تو کوئی اسے منزل پانے سے نہیں روک سکتا۔
LDC_Translation_1: The point is that if a man sets his sights on something, whatever his reason is behind that, nothing can stop him from getting what he wants.
LDC_Translation_2: The purpose of telling this story is that if a person has selected his destination with whatever background reasons, no one can stop him from reaching his destination.
LDC_Translation_3: The purpose of narrating this is if one specifies a goal, for whatever reason may there be, nothing could stop him from achieving his goal.
LDC_Translation_4: It is meant to say that if a man decides his destination, no matter what comes his way, no one can stop him from reaching there.
Turk_Translation_1: My purpose of saying this is that if a person has set a goal, whatever be the reason behind it, no one can stop him from achieving his goal.
Turk_Translation_2: The point of saying is that if a person picks his destiny, whatever is the reason behind it, no one can stop him from achieving that destiny.
Turk_Translation_3: The meaning of saying this is that if a man decides on one destiny then whatever comes afterward will not stop him to accomplish his destination.
Turk_Translation_4: What it means is that when a man decides the destination no matter what were the motives behind this no one can stop him from getting it.

Urdu: ہاں اگر آپ کو پتہ ہی نہیں ہے کہ کرنا کیا ہے تو پھر آپ کا اللہ ہی حافظ ہے۔
LDC_Translation_1: But if you don't even know what you want to do, only Allah can save you.
LDC_Translation_2: Well if you don't know what to do, then it will be very hard to succeed.
LDC_Translation_3: And well, if you do not know what you want to do, then only God is your savior.
LDC_Translation_4: Yes, if you don't know what to do then only Allah can save you.
Turk_Translation_1: But if you do not even know what you have to do, then Allah alone is your protector.
Turk_Translation_2: Here if you do not know what you have to do then God help you!
Turk_Translation_3: Yes and if you don't really know what you have to do then Allah is the only protector for you.
Turk_Translation_4: But if you don’t even know what you have to do then God be with you.

Urdu: کہتے ہیں کہ مرے ہوئے کو برا مت کہو مگر کیا کریں ہمیں بینظیر کی پہلی برسی پر بھِی ان میں برائیاں ہی نظر آتی ہیں۔
LDC_Translation_1: They say not to say bad things about the dead, but what should we do - we see nothing but Benazir's misdeeds even a year after she died.
LDC_Translation_2: It is said that those who have died should not be blamed, but what should be done when we only see faults in Benazir, even at her first death anniversary.
LDC_Translation_3: It is said that we should not speak ill of the deceased but what can we do. Even on the first death anniversary of Benazir, we can only remember her shortcomings.
LDC_Translation_4: It is said that one should not speak ill of the dead, but what could one do when only bad things are seen on the first anniversary of the death of Benazeer?
Turk_Translation_1: They say that you should not speak bad about the dead, but what can I do, even after one year of Benazir's death, I can only see faults in her.
Turk_Translation_2: It is said that do not say bad about the dead. But what shall we do, we see only bad things in Benazir even on her first death anniversary.
Turk_Translation_3: There is a saying that never say bad for a dead but what to do, also at the first death anniversary of Benazeer we only see bad in her.
Turk_Translation_4: It is said that don't accuse the dead, but can't help it as we see only evils in her on the first anniversary of Benazir.

Urdu: بینظیر نے اپنے مفاد کی خاطر آزادی کی جنگ لڑنے والے سکھوں کی لسٹ بھارت کو مہیا کر کے ایک طرف سکھوں کی تحریک آزادی کو کچل دیا اور دوسری طرف بھارت کو پنجاب کی تحریک دبانے کے بعد کشمیر میں پوری توجہ مرکوز کرنے کا موقع فراہم کیا۔
LDC_Translation_1: For the sake of her own interests, Benazir provided India a list of names of the Sikhs who were fighting for their independence, whereby on the one hand she crushed their independence movement, and on the other she gave India the opportunity to suppress the Punjab movement and focus all its attention on Kashmir.
LDC_Translation_2: Just to safeguard her own interests, Benazir provided the list of Sikh freedom fighters to India and thus on one hand crushed the independence movement of Sikhs and on the other hand allowed India an opportunity to pay full attention to Kashmir after having suppressed the movement in Punjab.
LDC_Translation_3: On the one hand, she crushed the independence movement of the Sikhs by providing the list of Sikh freedom fighters to India for the sake of her interests, and on the other hand she provided India with the chance to focus on Kashmir after crushing the movement in the Punjab.
LDC_Translation_4: On the one hand, Benazeer had arranged the list of Sikhs who were fighting for their freedom in India, and suppressed their movement, and on the other hand, she had given India a chance after suppressing the Punjab movement in order to concentrate on Kashmir.
Turk_Translation_1: For personal interests, Benazir handed over the list of Sikhs who were fighting for independence to India, at the same time crushing the Sikhs independence movement and also allowing India to transfer its complete attention to Pakistan, having taken care of the Punjab movement.
Turk_Translation_2: Benazir, for her selfish purpose, crushed the independence movement of the Sikhs after giving the list of their names who were fighting for freedom on one hand and on the other gave India the chance to keep its full attention on Kashmir after them helping to suppress Punjab Movement.
Turk_Translation_3: Benazeer for her own benefit forwarded to India the Sikhs' army, who were to fight the war of independent. On one side the independent movement of the Sikhs was collapsed and on the other side gave chance for India to concentrate on Kashmir after pushing down the Punjab movement.
Turk_Translation_4: On one side Benazir crushed independence movement of Sikhs by handing over the list of Sikh freedom fighters to India for her own sake and on the other hand provided India an opportunity to fully concentrate in Kashmir after crushing the movement in Punjab.

Urdu: بینطیر اور نواز شریف کی اقتدار کی رشہ کشی تاریخ کا حصہ ہے جس نے ملک کو کئِ سال پیچھے کی طرف دھکیل دیا۔
LDC_Translation_1: It was Benazir and Nawaz Sharif's tug-of-war for power that set the country many years behind.
LDC_Translation_2: The power tussle between Benazir and Nawaz Sharif is a part of history that pushed the country several years back.
LDC_Translation_3: Benazir and Nawaz Sharif's scramble for power which plunged the country many years back is recorded in history.
LDC_Translation_4: The rift of power between Benazeer and Nawaz Shareef is a part of history that has pushed the country many years back.
Turk_Translation_1: The Russia wars in the regimes of Benazir and Nawaz Sherif have become a part of history, which pushed the country many years back.
Turk_Translation_2: Tug of war between Benazir and Nawaz Sharif rule is part of the history, which has pushed the country back many years.
Turk_Translation_3: It is the part of the distraction from the leadership of Benazeer and Nawaz Sharif which have pushed the country to many years backwards.
Turk_Translation_4: The greed of Benazir and Nawaz Sharif for government is a part of history which pushed the country back for many years.

Urdu: بینظیر نے جلاوطنی کے دوران کشمیر اور ایٹمی پروگرام پر منفی بیانات کا سلسلہ جاری رکھا۔
LDC_Translation_1: Benazir, during her exile, continued to make negative statements about Kashmir and the atomic program.
LDC_Translation_2: During the period of her exile, Benazir continued to issue negative statements about Kashmir and the atomic program.
LDC_Translation_3: Benazir continued the streak of negative statements on Kashmir and the nuclear program during her exile.
LDC_Translation_4: During her banishment, Benazeer continued to give statements against Kashmir and the nuclear program.
Turk_Translation_1: Benazir continued to speak ill about Kashmir and the atomic program throughout exile.
Turk_Translation_2: Benazir continued to give negative comments on Kashmir and the nuclear program after being exiled.
Turk_Translation_3: During exile Benazeer continued on keeping the series beneficiary information of Kashmir and Atomic Program.
Turk_Translation_4: During her exile Benazir continued to give negative statements on Kashmir and Atomic Program.

Urdu: بینظیر نے نواز شریف کیساتھ لندن معاہدے کی خلاف ورزی کرتے ہوئے جنرل مشرف کیساتھ ڈیل کر لی۔
LDC_Translation_1: Violating the London agreement she had made with Nawaz Sharif, Benazir made a deal with General Musharraf.
LDC_Translation_2: Violating the agreement signed with Nawaz Sharif in London, Benazir entered into a deal with General Musharraf.
LDC_Translation_3: In violation of the London accord with Nawaz Sharif, Benazir struck a deal with General Musharraf.
LDC_Translation_4: Benazeer had dealt with General Musharraf, dishonoring his agreement with Nawaz Shareef in London.
Turk_Translation_1: Benazir Bhutto struck a deal with Musharraf, going against her London Treaty with Nawaz Sharif
Turk_Translation_2: Baenazir went against the pact made with Nawaz Shareef in London by making a deal with General Musharaf
Turk_Translation_3: Benazir violated the London agreement with Nawaz Sharif and made a deal with General Musharaf.
Turk_Translation_4: Benazir made a deal with Pervez Musharraf while betraying the London agreement with Nawaz Sharif.

Urdu: بینظیر نے اپنے دور اقتدار میں اپنے خاوند کو کھل کر پیسہ کمانے کا موقع دیا اور اسی وجہ سے وہ مسٹر ٹین پرسینٹ کہلائے
LDC_Translation_1: Benazir, during her time in office, freely gave her husband the opportunity to make money, and this is why he was called Mr. Ten Percent.
LDC_Translation_2: While in power, Benazir provided her husband with an opportunity to earn money in whatever ways he could, and this is why he was named as Mr. ten percent.
LDC_Translation_3: During her reign, she allowed her husband to openly amass wealth and for this reason, he was called Mr. Ten Percent
LDC_Translation_4: Benazeer, during his tenure, allowed her husband to earn much money. This has earned him the name of Mr. Ten Percent.
Turk_Translation_1: Benazir allowed her husband to openly earn money, in her era, which is why he came to be known as Mr. Ten Percent.
Turk_Translation_2: During the time of Baenazir's leadership she gave an open hand policy to her family members to earn money, and due to this he got to be known as Mr 10 Percent.
Turk_Translation_3: during her rule, Benazir gave a free hand to her husband to make as much money that is why he is known as Mr. Ten percent.
Turk_Translation_4: During her reign Benazir provided her husband the opportunity of making money and because of this he popularized as Mr. 10 percent.

Urdu: بینظیر کے دور میں اس کا بھائی قتل ہوا اور جس کے قاتل ابھِی تک سزا سے بچے ہوئے ہیں۔
LDC_Translation_1: During Benazir's time, her brother was murdered and his murderers have still not been punished.
LDC_Translation_2: While Benazir was in power her brother was murdered, but his killers are still safe from punishment.
LDC_Translation_3: During Benazir's reign, her brother was killed and his killers have not yet been punished.
LDC_Translation_4: Her brother was killed when she was in power, and his assassins are still at large.
Turk_Translation_1: In Benazir's era, her brother was killed, and his killer is still not been punished.
Turk_Translation_2: In the time of Baenazir her brother got murdered, and his murderers are still at large.
Turk_Translation_3: during Benazir's rule his brother got killed but his murderers are still safe from any punishment.
Turk_Translation_4: Benazir brother was killed during her reign whose assassins are still safe.

Urdu: بینظیر نے عورت ہونے کے باوجود عورتوں کے حقوق کی جنگ لڑنے سے گریز کیا۔
LDC_Translation_1: Despite being a woman herself, Benazir avoided fighting for women's rights.
LDC_Translation_2: Despite being a woman, Benazir avoided fighting for the rights of women.
LDC_Translation_3: Although she was a woman, Benazir avoided the fight for woman's rights.
LDC_Translation_4: Being a woman, Benazeer never raised her voice about women's rights.
Turk_Translation_1: Despite being a woman, Benazir avoided fighting for women rights.
Turk_Translation_2: Besides being a woman Baebnazir did not fight for the rights of women.
Turk_Translation_3: besides being a woman herself, Benazir avoided fighting for women's rights.
Turk_Translation_4: Though a woman still Benazir avoided to fight for the rights of women.

Urdu: جس طرح بینظیر نے اپنے والد کی لاش پر سیاست کی اسی طرح اب ان کے رنڈوے خاوند ان کی لاش پر سیاست کر رہے ہیں۔
LDC_Translation_1: In the same way Benazir thrived as a politician because of her father's death, her widowed husband is now thriving as a politician because of hers.
LDC_Translation_2: Just as Benazir did politics on the dead body of her father, in a similar style her widowed husband is doing politics on her dead body.
LDC_Translation_3: Just as Benazir played her politics over her father's corpse, similarly her widower husband is now playing his politics over her corpse.
LDC_Translation_4: The way Benazeer created her politics on her father's dead body, in the same way her widower husband is playing politics on her dead body.
Turk_Translation_1: In a way similar to how Benazir did politics on her father's corpse, her widower husband is now doing politics on her corpse.
Turk_Translation_2: The way in which Baenazir did politics on her fathers dead body, in the same way her followers are doing politics on the dead bodies of her family.
Turk_Translation_3: just like Benazir did her politics over her fathers dead body, similarly her widower is doing the same over her dead body.
Turk_Translation_4: Just like Benazir politicized her father's dead body similarly his widower husband politicizing her dead body.

Urdu: بینظیر کو دو دفعہ حکومت ملی مگر وہ اپنے والد کے سیاسی قتل کے مجرموں کو سزا تو کیا ان کیخلاف مقدمہ بھی درج نہ کرا سکیں۔
LDC_Translation_1: Benazir got control of the government twice, but she couldn't even file a case against those responsible for her father's political murder, let alone get them punished.
LDC_Translation_2: Benazir came into power twice, but not to talk of giving punishment to those involved in the political murder of her father, she even failed to get a case registered against them.
LDC_Translation_3: Benazir won the government twice but, punishment aside, she could not even get a case registered against the political murderers of her father.
LDC_Translation_4: Benazeer came to power twice, but she could not arrest the political killers of her father, and could not even initiate a case against them.
Turk_Translation_1: Benazir came to power twice, but let alone bring the people guilty for the political killing of her father to justice, she could not even file a case against them.
Turk_Translation_2: Baenazir got to be a leader twice and in that time punishing her fathers murders at one side she didn't even file charges against them.
Turk_Translation_3: Benazir came into power twice but she could not punish her the culprits of her father's political murder even she couldn't register a case against them.
Turk_Translation_4: Benazir reigned twice but not only she failed to punish her father's political murder but could not file a case against them.

Urdu: مشرقی پاکستان کو ہم سے الگ ہوئے سینتیس سال ہو گئے اور ہمارے عوام اور حکمرانوں کی بے حسی کی انتہا دیکھیں کہ کسی نے اس دن نہ سوگ منایا اور نہ اپنی غلطیوں پر ماتم کیا۔
LDC_Translation_1: It has been 37 years since East Pakistan separated from us, but look at the insensitivity of our people and our rulers - we neither mourned on this day nor lamented our mistakes.
LDC_Translation_2: Thirty-seven years have passed since the separation of East Pakistan from us, and look at the extreme of apathy that our public and rulers have demonstrated by neither mourning nor showing any regrets for their mistakes on this day.
LDC_Translation_3: It has been 37 years since the East Pakistan seceded. And look at the extent of the insensitivity of our people and the rulers that none of them either mourn or repent over their mistakes.
LDC_Translation_4: Thirty-seven years had passed when East Pakistan broke from us, and look at the apathy of our people and leaders that no one even feels sad about it, and no one is beating his chest over a mistake of our own.
Turk_Translation_1: It is 37 years since East Pakistan was separated from us, and look at the height of insensitivity on the part of the public and the rulers, that no one ever mourned or expressed sorrow over their mistakes.
Turk_Translation_2: It has been 37 years since the separation of eastern Pakistan, and sadly no leader condemns this day nor do they call it a black day.
Turk_Translation_3: it has been 37 years since East Pakistan separated from us but look at the extreme of senselessness of our people and leaders that we never celebrate the mourning day.
Turk_Translation_4: It has been thirty seven years since the separation of East Pakistan and look at the height of insensitivity of our people and rulers that neither did anyone mourn nor grieved over their mistakes on that day.

Urdu: ہونا تو یہ چاہیے تھا کہ ہم سولہ دسمبر والے دن کو عبرت کے طور پر مناتے اور اس طرح کی تدابیر کرتے کہ ایسا حادثہ دوبارہ وقوع پذیر نہ ہو۔
LDC_Translation_1: What we should have done was to commemorate December 16 as a lesson and come up with the kinds of strategies that could prevent such a misfortune from recurring.
LDC_Translation_2: We should have celebrated 16 December as a day of admonition and taken measures to prevent the reoccurrence of similar happenings.
LDC_Translation_3: The proper course of action should have been to commemorate December 16 as a day of admonition and we should have made such moves that such an accident would not happen again.
LDC_Translation_4: We should have remembered December 16 as an example and made sure that such things don't happen again.
Turk_Translation_1: We should have been observing 16th December as a day of reflection, and made plans to prevent the re occurrence of such incidents.
Turk_Translation_2: It should have been so that we would celebrate this 16th September as a black day, and take steps so such a sad incident never takes place again.
Turk_Translation_3: what should have happened instead is that we should have celebrated 16th December as a didactic day and take such measures that this kind of incident don't take place again.
Turk_Translation_4: It should have happened that we should look upon 16th December as a black day and should take appropraite steps so that this type of accident does not happen again.

Urdu: اس دن ہم بنگلہ دیش کے لوگوں کو خیرسگالی کے پیغامات بھیجتے اور انہیں دوبارھ اپنےقریب لانے کی کوشش کرتے۔
LDC_Translation_1: We should have sent goodwill messages to the people of Bangladesh on this day and tried to bring them close to us again.
LDC_Translation_2: We should have sent the messages of goodwill on this day to the people of Bangladesh and tried to bring them closer to us again.
LDC_Translation_3: We should have sent goodwill messages to the people of Bangladesh and tried to bring them closer to us again.
LDC_Translation_4: On that day, we could send messages of prosperity to the people of Bangladesh and try again to bring them closer.
Turk_Translation_1: We should have been sending greetings to the people of Bangladesh on this day and been trying to bring them closer to ourselves.
Turk_Translation_2: On this day we should have send the Bangali's letters of consolation and tried to bring them closer to ourselves.
Turk_Translation_3: on this day we could send greeting to the people of Bangladesh and try to bring them closer to ourselves again.
Turk_Translation_4: On that day, we send humanism messages to the people of Bangladesh and try to bring them closer to us.

Urdu: حکمران حمودالرحمن کمیشن کی فائل کو کھولتے اور اس میں مشرقی پاکستان کی علیحدگی کی وجوہات پر غور کرتے۔
LDC_Translation_1: Rulers should have opened the Hamood-ur-Rehman Commission's file and deliberated on the reasons for East Pakistan's separation.
LDC_Translation_2: Rulers should have opened the file of the Hamood-ur-Rahman Commission and pondered upon the reasons for separation of East Pakistan.
LDC_Translation_3: The rulers should have opened the Hamood-ur-Rehman Commission's Report and considered the reasons that led to the secession of East Pakistan.
LDC_Translation_4: Rulers would open Mehmoodurrahman's files and look into the reasons why Eastern Pakistan broke away.
Turk_Translation_1: The ruler should have opened the Jamudur Rahman commission file and pondered over the causes of separation of West Pakistan, mentioned therein.
Turk_Translation_2: Now we look at the reasons why eastern Pakistan was separated.
Turk_Translation_3: the rulers would reopen the Hamudur Rehman commission reports and discuss the reasons for the separation of East Pakistan.
Turk_Translation_4: Rulers open the file of Mehmood-ul-Rehman Commission in order to study the reasons for the separation of East Pakistan.

Urdu: بنگلہ دیش میں پھنسے ہوئے بہاریوں کو واپس لانے کی تدبیر کرتے اور ان کی حوصلہ افزائی کیلیے انہیں تحائف بھیجتے۔
LDC_Translation_1: They should have come up with a strategy for bringing back the Biharis stuck in Bangladesh, and sent them gifts to encourage them.
LDC_Translation_2: We should have taken measures to bring back the stranded Biharis in Bangladesh and sent them gifts for encouragement.
LDC_Translation_3: They should have thought about some way to bring back the Biharis stranded in Bangladesh and sent them gifts for encouragement.
LDC_Translation_4: Efforts should have been made to bring back the Biharis who are still strangled in Bangladesh and would have sent gifts to keep their spirits high.
Turk_Translation_1: to help the people who are sick and in trouble in Bangladesh and for their safe return planning and for motivation gifts are sent to them.
Turk_Translation_2: He would plan on bringing back the people of Bihar who were stuck in Bangladesh and he would send them gifts to keep their spirits up.
Turk_Translation_3: They used to make arrangements to bring back the Bahari's stuck in Bangladesh and send them presents to raise their spirits.
Turk_Translation_4: They are making strategies to bring back the Beharis (ethnic class) stranded in Bangladesh and send them gifts to encourage them.

Urdu: لیکن ہم بے حس ہو چکے ہیں ہمارے پڑوس میں کوئی مر جائے ہمیں اس کی اب اطلاع نہیں ہوتی۔
LDC_Translation_1: But we have become insensitive. If someone dies in our neighborhood, we do not even find out about it.
LDC_Translation_2: But we have turned so senseless that if someone dies in our neighborhood, we have no information about this.
LDC_Translation_3: But we have become insensitive. If someone dies next door, we do not get the information now.
LDC_Translation_4: But we have become insensitive; if someone dies in our neighborhood, we don't know it.
Turk_Translation_1: we have no feeling, our neighbors get died and we dont even know about it
Turk_Translation_2: We have become so insensitive that if someone dies in our neighborhood, we are not even aware of it.
Turk_Translation_3: But we lack feelings now. We are not even aware if someone dies in our neighborhood.
Turk_Translation_4: But we have become so indifferent that when someone dies in our own neighborhood we don't know about it.

Urdu: ہمیں اپنے بہن بھائیوں کی فکر نہیں رہی کیونکہ ہم خودغرض ہو چکے ہیں۔
LDC_Translation_1: We don't care about our sisters and brothers anymore because we've become selfish.
LDC_Translation_2: We don't have any concerns for our sisters and brothers because we have become selfish.
LDC_Translation_3: We no more care for our brothers and sisters because we have become selfish.
LDC_Translation_4: We don't care for our brothers and sisters because we have become selfish.
Turk_Translation_1: we don't care about brothers and sisters because we are selfish.
Turk_Translation_2: We do not care for our brothers and sisters because we have become selfish.
Turk_Translation_3: We do not care about our brothers and sisters because we have become selfish.
Turk_Translation_4: We are not even concerned about our brothers because we have become too self-centered.

Urdu: بڑے سے بڑا سانحہ گزر جائے ہم اگلے دن پھر اپنے معمولات زندگی میں کھو جاتے ہیں۔
LDC_Translation_1: Even if a great tragedy occurs, the next day we get tied up in our day-to-day affairs.
LDC_Translation_2: Even after the occurrence of the greatest of tragedies, we get deeply occupied the next day with the usual affairs of life.
LDC_Translation_3: No matter how great a tragedy may befall us, we get back to business the next day.
LDC_Translation_4: Regardless of what big tragedy occurs, we go about our lives normally the following day.
Turk_Translation_1: big crisis get over and we became normal and return to our routines.
Turk_Translation_2: A huge calamity can pass by, but the next day we are lost in our day-to-day routine of life.
Turk_Translation_3: Even if a great accident occurs, we are busy in our daily routines of life from the next day.
Turk_Translation_4: Even after big tragedies we return to our routine life the next day.

Urdu: کاش جس طرح مشرقی اور مغربی جرمنی دوبارہ ایک ہو گئے اسی طرح مشرقی اور مغربی پاکستان بھی دوبارہ ایک ہو سکتے۔
LDC_Translation_1: I wish East and West Pakistan could reunite the same way that East and West Germany did.
LDC_Translation_2: Would that as East and West Germany became united again, in a similar style East and West Pakistan too had become united again.
LDC_Translation_3: As the East and West Germany have unified, would that East and West Pakistan could unify once again.
LDC_Translation_4: The way East and West Germany became one, I wish East and West Pakistan would become one again.
Turk_Translation_1: As eastern Germany and western Germany merges together i wish if East and West Pakistan get together.
Turk_Translation_2: If only East and West Pakistan could become one again, like East and West Germany became one.
Turk_Translation_3: Only if East and West Pakistan could be one together just like East and West Germany was united once again.
Turk_Translation_4: Perhaps, like East and West Germany were united, in the same way, East and West Pakistan will also be united once more.

Urdu: ہم دوبارہ ایک ہو سکتے ہیں اگر دونوں ایک دوسرے کیلیے قربانی ديں اور خودغرضی کے خول سے باہر نکل آئیں۔
LDC_Translation_1: We can be one again if both make sacrifices for each other and break out of the shell of selfishness.
LDC_Translation_2: We can become united again if we sacrifice for each other and get out of the shell of selfishness.
LDC_Translation_3: We can again unify if both sacrifice for each other and come out of the shell of selfishness.
LDC_Translation_4: We can once again become one if both sacrifice for each other and come out of the shell of selfishness.
Turk_Translation_1: we can be one again, if we scarifies for each other and get over with our selfishness.
Turk_Translation_2: We can become one again, if we sacrifice a little for each other and leave our selfishness behind us.
Turk_Translation_3: We can be one again if we both sacrifice for each other and come out of the hole of selfishness.
Turk_Translation_4: We can still be united if we are prepared to make sacrifices for each other and come out of the crust of selfishness.

Urdu: لیکن یہ خواہش مستقبل قریب میں پوری ہوتی نظر نہیں آتی۔
LDC_Translation_1: But it doesn't look like this wish will be fulfilled anytime in the near future.
LDC_Translation_2: But this desire is not likely to be fulfilled in the near future.
LDC_Translation_3: But I do not see this wish coming true in the near future.
LDC_Translation_4: But this desire doesn't seem likely to be fulfilled in the near future.
Turk_Translation_1: This wish (dream) cant seem to come true in near Future.
Turk_Translation_2: But this wish does not look like it will be fulfilled in the near future.
Turk_Translation_3: But this wish does not seem to be granted in the near future.
Turk_Translation_4: But this wish does not seem to be fulfilled in the near future

Urdu: آج جب خبروں میں بتایا گیا کہ امریکی ریاست الی نوائے کا گورنر کرپشن چارجز میں گرفتار کر لیا گیا
LDC_Translation_1: Today, when it was stated in the news that the governor of the American state of Illinois was arrested on charges of corruption
LDC_Translation_2: News came in today's broadcast saying that the Governor of the State of Illinois in the United States has been arrested for corruption charges.
LDC_Translation_3: When it was reported in the news today that the Governor of the American state Illinois had been arrested on corruption charges
LDC_Translation_4: Today's news revealed that the Governor of the American state of Illinois has been arrested under corruption charges.
Turk_Translation_1: Today in new it was said that Governor of illinois is arrested for corruption.
Turk_Translation_2: Today, when it was announced in the news that the governor of American state Illinois was caught on corruption charges
Turk_Translation_3: When it was announced in the news today that the Governor of the American State Illinois was arrested for corruption charges
Turk_Translation_4: Today when it was told in the news that Governor of American State Illinois has been arrested for charges of corruption

Urdu: اور اسے گورنری سے ہٹانے کیلیے صوبائی کانگریس جلد سے جلد اس کا محاسبہ کرنے کی تیاری کرنے لگ Edit ی ہے تو ہمارے ایک امریکی گورے ساتھی جن کی پاکستان کے حالات پر گہری نظر ہوتی ہے نے ہمیں شیخی بگھارتے ہوئے لکارا کہ دیکھو جمہوریت اسے کہتے ہیں۔
LDC_Translation_1: and that to take him out of office, the Provincial Congress has started to make preparations to call him to account as soon as possible, one of our white American friends who keeps a close watch on the situation in Pakistan challenged us as he boasted, "See, this is what democracy is."
LDC_Translation_2: To remove him from the governorship, the provincial congress has moved very quickly with the preparation for his accountability. An American white man who keeps a careful eye on Pakistan's affairs boastfully challenged me by citing this example of democracy.
LDC_Translation_3: and as the state congress was preparing for his impeachment at the earliest to remove him from the governorship, a white American friend of mine who keeps a keen eye on the situation in Pakistan bragged to me that this was called democracy.
LDC_Translation_4: Provincial Congress is preparing to hold him accountable and remove him from the post of Governor. One of our American white friends who keeps an eye on the situation in Pakistan challenged us proudly and said, "Look, this is democracy."
Turk_Translation_1: to remove him from the office of Governor, State Congress is preparing to start trial against him as soon as possible. one of our friend who has keen eye on the current affairs of Pakistan proudly said that this is democracy.
Turk_Translation_2: and that he would soon be brought to account for removal from Governorship by the state congress, an American white friend of mine, who had deep insight into the situation in Pakistan, he told us, showing off, look this is called democracy.
Turk_Translation_3: and when the State Congress started getting ready to remove him from the position of the governor as soon as possible, then there is this one American companion who has a close watch on the circumstances of Pakistan, boastfully claimed to us that this is what we call democracy.
Turk_Translation_4: and to remove him from governorship provincial Congress is preparing for his rapid accountability, our American friend who has a keen interest in Pakistani affairs exaggeratedly said to me 'see this is democracy'.

Urdu: امریکہ میں بڑے سے بڑا آدمی بھی قانون سے ماورا نہیں ہے
LDC_Translation_1: Not even the most important person in America is above the law.
LDC_Translation_2: In America, even the powerful are not above the law.
LDC_Translation_3: Even the strongest man is not above law in America
LDC_Translation_4: In America, even the biggest man is not above the law,
Turk_Translation_1: In USA Every man is equal under Law.
Turk_Translation_2: In America, no gigantic figure is beyond the law.
Turk_Translation_3: In America, even the higher level people can not transcendence the law.
Turk_Translation_4: No one is beyond the law in America.

Urdu: اور ایک تمہارا ملک پاکستان ہے جس کا صدر بھی کرپشن چارجز ڈراپ کرانے کے بعد بنا ہے۔
LDC_Translation_1: And then we have your country, Pakistan, where even the president came into office only after getting the corruption charges dropped.
LDC_Translation_2: And in your country Pakistan, even the president came into power after getting corruption charges dropped against himself.
LDC_Translation_3: and then there is your country Pakistan whose President has taken office only after getting the corruption charges against him dropped.
LDC_Translation_4: and there is your country Pakistan whose President got his charges dropped to become the President.
Turk_Translation_1: And there is your country, whose president was made after he had the corruption charges dropped.
Turk_Translation_2: and there is your country Pakistan whose president has been elected after dropping of corruption charges.
Turk_Translation_3: And the other is your country, Pakistan, where even the President was chosen after the corruption charges against him were dropped.
Turk_Translation_4: and here is your country Pakistan whose president was dropped of the corruption charges before sworn in.

Urdu: ہماری رگ ظرافت پھڑکی اور ہم نے کہا اگر مریکہ میں ایک گورنر گرفتار ہوا ہے تو کیا ہوا، ہمارے پاکستان میں تو راتوں رات وزیراعظم کو گرفتار کر کے ایک بار پھانسی چڑھایا گیا اور دوسری بار ملک بدر کیا گیا۔
LDC_Translation_1: I took it with a sense of humor and said, "So what if one governor was arrested in America? In our Pakistan, the prime minister was arrested and hanged overnight one time, and another one was sent into exile.
LDC_Translation_2: I responded in a joking way, saying that the arrest of a governor in America is totally worthless if compared with Pakistan, where one prime minister was arrested and hanged and another was exiled in no time.
LDC_Translation_3: Our sense of humor was stirred and we replied that the arrest of one Governor in America was not a big deal since in our country one prime minister was arrested and hanged overnight and the other one was exiled in no time.
LDC_Translation_4: My witty nature did not let me take a back seat, so I said, so what if one governor is arrested in America? In our Pakistan, one Prime Minister was arrested in the night to be hanged and other was banished.
Turk_Translation_1: we felt our nerve of wit and said that what if a governor was arrested in America,in our Pakistan once our prime minister was arrested during the night and was hanged and the other time was exiled.
Turk_Translation_2: my sense of humor woke and I said that what's wrong if a governor got arrested in America, in Pakistan, once we arrested the Prime Minister overnight and hanged him and the second time we exiled one.
Turk_Translation_3: My vein of loyalty throbbed and I said what is the big deal if a governor was arrested in America. In our Pakistan, once the Prime Minister was arrested and hanged overnight, and another time sent into exile.
Turk_Translation_4: My sense of humor rouse and I said what's strange if a governor has been arrested in America, in our Pakistan prime minister was arrested overnight and once was hanged and second time was exiled.

Urdu: بتاؤ کبھی امریکہ میں ایسا ہوا؟
LDC_Translation_1: Tell me, did this ever happen in America?"
LDC_Translation_2: Tell me if this has even happened in America.
LDC_Translation_3: Tell us if such a thing had ever happened in America?
LDC_Translation_4: Tell me if this has ever happened in America?
Turk_Translation_1: Tell me if anything like this has happened in America?
Turk_Translation_2: tell me when it happened in America?
Turk_Translation_3: Tell me, when did this happen in America?
Turk_Translation_4: Tell me, has it ever happened in America?

Urdu: پاکستان نے تو ملک کا قانون توڑنے والے کو گارڈ آف آنر کیساتھ صدارتی ایوان سے رخصت کیا، بتاؤ کیا امریکہ میں کبھی ایسا ہوا؟
LDC_Translation_1: Pakistan gave a guard of honor to a president who broke the national law as he left his house. Tell me, did this ever happen in America?
LDC_Translation_2: In Pakistan, the one who broke the constitution was offered a guard of honor before his departure from the presidential palace; tell me if this has ever happened in America?
LDC_Translation_3: Pakistan saw off the President from the presidential palace with guard of honor who had dismissed the constitution of the country? Tell us if it had ever happened in America?
LDC_Translation_4: Pakistan had awarded the badge of honor to a law breaker before his departure from the presidential house; tell me if this has ever happened in America?
Turk_Translation_1: Pakistan awarded guard of honor and bid farewell from the president house who broke the law of the country. Tell me if anything like this has happened in America?
Turk_Translation_2: Pakistan sent off the lawbreaker with guard of honor from the presidency, tell me when did such thing happened it America?
Turk_Translation_3: In Pakistan, those who broke the law were sent out of the presidential palace with a guard of honor. Tell me when this happened in America.
Turk_Translation_4: In Pakistan the country law breaker has been departed from President House with guard of honor, tell me has it ever happened in America?

Urdu: پاکستان میں چیف جسٹس کو ایسا معطل کیا گیا کہ عوامی سپورٹ ہونے کے باوجود وہ ابھی تک بحال نہیں ہو سکا، کیا امریکہ میں ایسا ہوا؟
LDC_Translation_1: In Pakistan, the chief justice was suspended in such a way that, despite having popular support, he still has not been reinstated. Did this ever happen in America?
LDC_Translation_2: In Pakistan, the Chief Justice was suspended, and despite public support, he has not been reinstated up to now; has this happened in America?
LDC_Translation_3: In Pakistan, the Chief Justice was dismissed in such a way that despite having public support he has not yet been reinstated. Has it happened in America?
LDC_Translation_4: In Pakistan, the Chief Justice was removed, and could not be reinstated even with popular support. Has this ever happened in America?
Turk_Translation_1: Chief Justice of Pakistan was laid off in such a way that even after nations support, he has yet not reinstated. Tell me if anything like this has happened in America?
Turk_Translation_2: In Pakistan, the Chief Justice was suspended in such a way that besides the public support he has not be restored so far, did it ever happened in America?
Turk_Translation_3: The Chief Justice of Pakistan was removed in such a manner, that despite having public support, he could not be replaced until now. Has this happened in America?
Turk_Translation_4: In Pakistan Chief Justice has been dismissed as despite of public support he is not reinstated yet, has this ever happened in America?

Urdu: پاکستان میں جعلی ڈگری ہولڈر کو وزیرصحت بنایا گیا، کیا امریکہ میں ایسا ہوا؟
LDC_Translation_1: The holder of a counterfeit degree was made the Minister of Health in Pakistan. Did this ever happen in America?
LDC_Translation_2: In Pakistan, a fake degree holder was made the minister for health, has this happened in America?
LDC_Translation_3: A fake degree holder was appointed health minister in Pakistan. Did it ever happen in America?

Urdu: حضرت فرماتے ہيں دنيا ميں زيادہ تر خون مذاہب کی بنياد پر بہايا گيا ہے، آپ مجھے بتا ديں کہ اگر مذہب نہ ہوتا تو کيا يہ خون خرابہ نہ ہوتا؟
LDC_Translation_1: The gentleman says, "Most of the blood in the world has been spilled on the basis of religions; tell me now, would there be all this killing if there were no religion?"
LDC_Translation_2: The respectable gentleman says that in the world, most of the bloodshed was caused by religion. You tell me if there had been no religion at all, had this bloodshed not happened.
LDC_Translation_3: His Highness says that most of the blood in the world has been shed in the name of religion. Tell me that if there had been no religion, would no bloodshed had taken place?
LDC_Translation_4: Hadrat said that religion has been the reason for all the bloodshed in the world. Tell me: if there were no religion, wouldn't there have been this bloodshed?
Turk_Translation_1: You say that mostly blood is spilled in the world because of religion. Tell me today, if there was no religion, would all this killing not take place?
Turk_Translation_2: He has said that religion is the reason of bloodshed; kindly tell me if it would be a peaceful world without any concept of religion?
Turk_Translation_3: He says that most of the blood is spilt in the name of religion, tell me that if religion was not then blood wouldnt have spilt?

Urdu: پنجابی، پٹھان، گورا اور کالا، محسود اور دوسرے قبائل کيا يہ سب کچھ مذہب کی پيداوار ہيں؟

Turk_Translation_4: Punjabi, Pathan. white and black, Mehsud and other tribes, are all these created by religion?

Urdu: نہيں ہرگز نہيں، جناب، مذہب ہی يہ تعليم ديتا ہے کہ کوئی گورا کوئی کالا نہيں کوئی پنجابی کوئی مہاجر نہيں ورنہ اگر مذہب نہ ہوتا توگورے کالےکی لڑائی ميں آدھی دنيا اور ذات برادری کی عداوت باقی انسان غرق ہوجاتے۔
LDC_Translation_1: No, absolutely not. Sir, religion is what teaches us that there is no black or white, no Punjabi or Muhajir. If there were no religion, half the world would have been destroyed in the battle between blacks and whites and the rest in the animosity between races.
LDC_Translation_2: No, not at all. Sir, only religion teaches us that there is no white, no black, no Punjabi, and no refugee. If there had been no religion, then half of the world would have been destroyed in the war between white and black, and the rest would have fallen prey to enmity on the basis of cost and race.
LDC_Translation_3: No, absolutely not. Sir, religion preaches that there is no distinction either between a white and a black or a Punjabi and Muhajir. Had there been no religion, half the world would have been killed in the wars of color and the rest would have perished due to the enmities based on caste.
LDC_Translation_4: No, not at all, sir. Religion teaches no difference between a white and a black, a Punjabi and a Muhajir. If it was not for religion, this world would long ago have been destroyed in the name of white and black and countless other caste-based conflicts.

If it were not for religion, then half of the world would have been destroyed in fights between the white and the black, and the rest of the people would have drowned in tribe-brotherhood hatred.

Turk_Translation_4: Not at all, sir, religion preaches us that there is no white, black, Punjabi or Muhajir, if there is no religion then half of the world would have been destroyed by the war of black and white and remaining half by the war of cast.

Urdu: دراصل مذہب ہی انسان کو اخلاقی تربيت ديتا ہے اور اسے پابند کرتا ہے وہ يہاں اپنی مرضی سے نہيں آيا بلکہ خالق کائنات نے اس کو يہاں بھيجا ہے اور اسے يہاں اسی کے حکم کے مطابق زندگی بسر کرنی ہے۔
LDC_Translation_1: Actually, it is religion that gives humans moral training and restraints. Humans did not come here on their own - the creator of the universe sent them here, and they must live according to His command.

Urdu: لندن ميں رہائش اختيار کرنے کے بعد کی سال تک ميں ہر صبح پہلے ٹيلفون پر اپنے ہر رشتہ دار کی خيرت معلوم کرتی حالانکہ بيشتر نے کبھی ايک بار بھی فون کرکے ہماری خبر نہيں لی پھر مجھے احساس ہوگيا کہ انہيں ہمارا فون کرنا بھی گوارا نہيں ہوتا ہم نے فون کرنا چھوڑ ديا۔
LDC_Translation_1: After moving to London, for several years I called each of my relatives first thing in the morning to ask how they were doing, although most of them had never even called me once to ask how I was doing. Then I realized that they do not even like me calling them. I stopped calling them.
LDC_Translation_2: After having settled in London, for several years I used to call each relative daily in the morning to get to know their health, but despite this, the majority of them did not even call on a single occasion to inquire about us; then I realized that they weren't even welcoming our telephone call and I stopped calling them.
LDC_Translation_3: After taking up residence in London, I used to call each of my relatives every morning to ask about their well being even though they did not return the favor even once. Then I realized that they even did not like our calling them and we stopped making the calls.
LDC_Translation_4: After settling down in London, every morning I would call my relatives to ask about their well-being, whereas the fact is that not one of them had ever bothered to call me and ask how we are doing. Then I realized that they don't even like us to call them. I stopped calling them.

Turk_Translation_2: After living in London, for many years I used to ask wellness of my family over the telephone every morning. Although many did not even call once to find out how we were. Then I realized that they do not even tolerate our phone calls so we stopped calling.
Turk_Translation_3: Even after the time i acquired the luxuries in London, I continued to call up my relatives on every morning to find out about their good and bad.Even though my relatives never bothered to call me ever in my life. But still i continued to do so. But the time when i felt that my relatives dont even like my calling them, i stopped making calls to them ever after.
Turk_Translation_4: After moving to London, I used to call my relatives back home every single morning, although they never called us even once. Then I realized they were inconvenienced by our calling as well, so we stopped.

LDC_Translation_1: Ideally, both nations should live together in peace, but since their strings are in the hands of the West and the Arab countries, there can never be peace here without their approval.

LDC_Translation_1: The interests of BBC's country lie with favoring America and Israel, and this is the reason why it has come out with a series of blogs on "Zionism" in the guise of "open-mindedness" and is making blind and one-sided "propaganda."

LDC_Translation_1: It's no use talking about Islam; in reality we only like what goes along with our traditions and customs.
LDC_Translation_2: Repeating the name of Islam brings nothing; factually we like only those things that are in accordance with our customs and traditions.
LDC_Translation_3: Singing the songs of Islam is useless because we actually like the things that are according to our customs and traditions.
LDC_Translation_4: Nothing happens by only blowing the trumpet of Islam. We actually like whatever is in our culture and custom.
Turk_Translation_1: Nothing happens with singing about Islam. We actually like what our traditions and cultures are.
Turk_Translation_2: Saying Islam, Islam from the mouth does not do any thing, we like the thing which are there in rituals
Turk_Translation_3: Chanting Islam, Islam does not mean anything. In reality, we like only our culture and traditions.
Turk_Translation_4: The customs of US and Islamabad are not really the same as said by the tourists

Urdu: مثلاً ونی، کاری، لڑکیوں کو تعلیم سے بے بہرہ رکھنا اور پسند کی شادی پر ڈز۔
LDC_Translation_1: For instance trading girls for marriage, killing girls for accusations of adultery, depriving girls of an education, and shooting them for marrying of their own choice.
LDC_Translation_2: For example, Wani, Kari, keeping the girls illiterate and gun bullet for the marriage of own choice.
LDC_Translation_3: For instance Vanni, Kari, keeping the girls illiterate and killings by gun shots on love marriage.
LDC_Translation_4: For example TV, vehicles and keeping girls away from education, and there is a fear about marrying by one's own choice.
Turk_Translation_1: For example, keeping girls from getting education and fear of love marriage.
Turk_Translation_2: like, demotivation for the girls education, and love marriage, etc.,
Turk_Translation_3: For instance keeping girls from gaining education and fearing marrying the girl of ones choice.
Turk_Translation_4: Like that of the the culture of the girls, education, marriages etc.

Urdu: رہا آپ والا سوال تو بڑے صاحب بیوہ کو گھر لانے کے بجائے خود کسی بیوہ کے گھر چلے جاتے تو وارثین اوپر اوپر سے شورو غوغا کر کے چُپ اور مطمئن ہوجاتے (ہاں بیوہ کے وارثین کے پیٹ میں پھر مروڑ اُٹھتی)۔
LDC_Translation_1: As far as your question is concerned, instead of bringing the widow to his own home, if the man had gone to the widow's home, his heirs would have settled down and been satisfied after making some fuss about it (although the widow's heirs would then become jealous).
LDC_Translation_2: As far your question is concerned, instead of bringing the widow to his home, if the gentleman had gone to the widow's home, the relatives would have become quiet after making some formal hue and cry (but this would have disturbed the stomachs of the widow's relatives).
LDC_Translation_3: As far as your question is concerned, had the old man shifted to the widow's house after marriage rather than bringing her home, his heirs would have made token protests and then gone quiet and content (the heirs of the widow would then have had butterflies in their stomachs).
LDC_Translation_4: As far as your question is concerned, then Mister, why do you bring a widow home? Instead, you should be going to her house so that the relatives keep quiet after creating artificial havoc (well, there will be a stomach ache in the widow's family).
Turk_Translation_1: And about your question, when sir instead of bringing his wife home, goes to someone else's wife so the dependents just make a fuss for the show and stay quiet and satisfied. ( yeah, later the relatives of the wife get angry)
Turk_Translation_2: now your Question is, if the big brother rather bringing the widow to his home, he might have went to her home itself, then there will no querrals from his children, (they quarrel may be in the widows children)
Turk_Translation_3: As for your question about the old man going to the widows house instead of bringing the widow to his house, so that the children could make some fuss and then become quiet and relax, (though the stomach of the widows children would hurt).
Turk_Translation_4: The question is that, the widow of the house have a abdominal contraction again.

Urdu: برصغیر پاک و ہند میں ہم نے اسلام تو صدیوں پہلے قبول کر لیا مگر اس جاہلانہ سوچ سے پیچھا آج تک نہ چھڑا سکے اور رسم و رواج کو اسلام سے مقدم ہی جانا۔
LDC_Translation_1: Although we accepted Islam in the Indian sub-continent centuries ago, to this day we have not been able to get rid of this ignorant mindset and still prefer tradition and custom over Islam.
LDC_Translation_2: In the Indo-Pak subcontinent, we accepted Islam centuries ago, but could not get rid of irrational beliefs till today and gave preference to customs and traditions upon religion.
LDC_Translation_3: We embraced Islam many centuries back in the Indian subcontinent but could not get rid of this ignorant mindset and preferred customs and traditions to Islam.
LDC_Translation_4: In the Indo-Pak sub-continent, we embraced Islam many centuries ago, but we could not get away with this thinking and preferred customs and traditions to Islam.
Turk_Translation_1: In the Indian subcontinent, we accepted Islam centuries ago but we could not let go of this illiterate thinking and always thought of culture and tradition as more valuable than Islam.
Turk_Translation_2: We embraced Islam even before the separation of hindustan and Pakistan, but we have not came out of such evil thinking and this ritual are a more important than islam
Turk_Translation_3: In the Indo Pak subcontinent, Islam was accepted centuries ago, but it could not yet leave its ignorant mentality and has always kept culture and tradition above Islam.
Turk_Translation_4: In IndopPak we embraced Islam centuries ago but can't get rid of this unlettered thinking and considered traditions and customs superior then Islam.

Urdu: مرد کی دوسری شادی کو واہیات، طلاق کو کلنک کا ٹیکا، طلاق یافتہ عورت کو اچھوت، پسند کی شادی کو عزت پر داغ اور مرد کی اپنے سے بڑی عمر کی عورت سے شادی کو اس عورت کی مکاری کا نتیجہ سمجھنا اسی سوچ کی وجہ سے ہی ہے۔
LDC_Translation_1: A man's second marriage is obscene, divorce is a blot that cannot be hidden, a divorced woman is untouchable, marriage by choice ruins reputations, and a man's marriage with a older woman is seen as a result of the woman's trickery. All these attitudes reflect the same mindset.
LDC_Translation_2: Terming a man's second marriage as immoral, divorce a sign of shame, a divorced woman as an untouchable, love marriage as a sign of disrespect and a man marrying a woman of higher age as the cleverness of woman, is a result of this way of thinking.
LDC_Translation_3: To consider the second marriage of a man as livid, divorce as a stigma, a divorced woman as an untouchable, love marriage as a shameful act, and the marriage of a younger man with an older woman as a sign of her wickedness are the results of this particular mindset.
LDC_Translation_4: Because of this pattern of thinking, we consider a second marriage of a male as bad, divorce as a blot, divorcee women an untouchable, marriage of one's choice as a stain on one's honor, and marriage of a man with an aged woman is considered a deceitful tactics of the woman.
Turk_Translation_1: Considering man's 2nd marriage as ridiculous, divorce as denigration, divorced as untouchable, love marriage as dishonor and considering a man marrying an older women is dissimulation of the women is only the result of this way of thinking.
Turk_Translation_2: The second marriage of a man is bad, Divorce is known to be bad, The divorced women is a untouchability sin, love marriage is the bad impression, the marriage of a man with a elder woman is said to be the evil plan of the woman. the above things are of such evil thinkings
Turk_Translation_3: Thinking of a man's second marriage as an innovation, divorce as a clinical rest, divorced woman as untouchable, love marriage as a mark on honor and a man marrying a woman elder to him as a deception on the part of the wife, is all a part of this mentality.
Turk_Translation_4: Second marriage of man as ridiculous, divorce as stigma, divorced woman as untouchable, love marriage as disgrace and man's marriage with an elder woman as the result of her cunningness is all because of such thinking.

Urdu: اور تو اور مغربی اقوام کی نقل میں ہم پرہیزگاری اور پردے کو دقیانوسی قرار دیتے ہیں۔
LDC_Translation_1: And to copy the Western nations we call abstinence and using the veil an outdated thing.
LDC_Translation_2: As a result of blindly following the culture of Western nations, we regard Purdah and virtuousness as outdated concepts.
LDC_Translation_3: Furthermore, in the footsteps of the western nations we declare abstention and Purdah as old fashioned.
LDC_Translation_4: On top of that, while imitating the West, we condemn prayers and Pardah as old fashioned.
Turk_Translation_1: And over all, by copying the western world, we are declaring the religious and veil as old fashioned.
Turk_Translation_2: and we think that if we wont follow modernism, we considered to a old thinking man
Turk_Translation_3: What's more, in mimicry of the western countries, we have started to consider piety and veil as old fashioned.
Turk_Translation_4: Moreover to copy the western nations we declare veil and worship backward.

Urdu: اسلام قبول کرنا تو آسان تھا اس سوچ سے پیچھا چھڑانا بہت مشکل۔
LDC_Translation_1: Accepting Islam was easy; getting rid of this mindset is very difficult.
LDC_Translation_2: It was easier to accept Islam but it was very difficult to get rid of thoughts like this.
LDC_Translation_3: It was easier to embrace Islam than to get rid of that mindset.
LDC_Translation_4: Embracing Islam was easy but getting away from this thought was tough.
Turk_Translation_1: Accepting Islam was easy, getting rid of this way of thinking is very hard.
Turk_Translation_2: Embracing islam is easy, but to come out from such evil thinking is some what impossible
Turk_Translation_3: Accepting Islam is easy, but leaving this mentality is very tough.
Turk_Translation_4: It was easy to embrace Islam to get rid of such thinking is very difficult.

Urdu: اللہ ھم سب کو اس کی ہمت اور جراٰت عطا فرماےء۔
LDC_Translation_1: May Allah give us all the strength and courage for this.
LDC_Translation_2: May Allah give us all the courage and boldness to do this.
LDC_Translation_3: May God grant us power and courage for this.
LDC_Translation_4: May Allah give us audacity for this.
Turk_Translation_1: Allah give us courage and Daringness.
Turk_Translation_2: Allah bless us with the ability and courage to do this task.
Turk_Translation_3: Allah grant us all spirit and courage for this.
Turk_Translation_4: Allah bless us all the courage for it.

LDC_Translation_3: Ameen.
LDC_Translation_4: Ameen.

LDC_Translation_3: Writing in Urdu was never so difficult.

LDC_Translation_1: Consider this little bit enough.
LDC_Translation_2: Consider the less too much.
LDC_Translation_3: Be content with this little effort.
LDC_Translation_4: Think more of the less I wrote.

Turk_Translation_2: Think of this less as a lot.
Turk_Translation_3: Know that little is much.

Urdu: اللہ حافظ۔
LDC_Translation_1: May Allah protect you.
LDC_Translation_2: May God protect you.
LDC_Translation_3: May God take care of you.

Turk_Translation_4: Allah Hafiz.

Urdu: امیر تیمور اپنی کتاب “ میں ہوں تیمور “ میں لکھتا ہے کہ میں نے اپنی زندگی میں یہ راز پایا کہ اگر کسی فوج کا سپہ سالار صف اول میں ہوگا تو وہ فوج کبھی ناکام نہیں‌ہوگی۔
LDC_Translation_1: Ameer Taimur in his book I Am Taimur writes that I have learned one thing in life - if the commander of an army is on the front line that army will never lose.
LDC_Translation_2: Amir Taimur in his book "I am Taimur" writes that the life secret he learned in his life is that if the commander of an army stays at the front position, that army will never face defeat.
LDC_Translation_3: Amir Timur wrorte in his book 'I am Timur' that if the head of an army was found in the first line of attack, that army would never be defeated.
LDC_Translation_4: Ameer Taimur thus writes in his book "I am Taimur", "I learned this secret in my life: that if a Commander-in-Chief of an army stands in the line of fire, that army will never be defeated.
Turk_Translation_1: Amir Taimoor Write on his book "i am Tamioor" thati have discovered secret in my life that if any force commander in chief on the first raw so that force never loss.
Turk_Translation_2: Ameer Taimur in his book "I am Taimur" writes I found the secret in my living time that if the commander of any army is present on the front line then that army will never be defeated.
Turk_Translation_3: Ameer Taimoor in his book "I am Taimoor" writes that i found this secret in my life that if leader of any Army is in front line then that Army will never lose.
Turk_Translation_4: Amir taymoori in his book "Main hoon Taymoor" writes I realized in my life a secret that if the military commander of the military is in first row then that military would never loose.

LDC_Translation_1: They say, "The common people are here to die for us. If we die, we're martyrs."
LDC_Translation_2: They say that the public is only to die for us and if we die we are martyrs.
LDC_Translation_3: these guys say that the public is destined to die for us and if we die, we are martyrs
LDC_Translation_4: They say that people are there to die for us. If I die, I am martyred.

LDC_Translation_1: If a common person dies, it's just a casualty.

LDC_Translation_3: the death of a commoner is nothing more than a murder
LDC_Translation_4: If a commoner dies, he is killed.
